reviewText:
Great actor! I enjoyed watching all 10 of these movies!
If you love westerns you will enjoy this pack of Western movies.
I recommend this seller.
This dvd does not even put the full picture on the screen show maybe a n arm  or face the rest of body missing on side of screen  could not watch waste of money
My Dad loves Westerns.  He doesn't have much money.  He lives on a fixed income so I was able to purchase this for him.  It gave him 10 movies.  Great price and shipped quickly.
this is a great movie  pkg,  old  movies are  just fun  to watch.if like old westerns you will love this one.

...that Amazon does not provide sufficient information as to the contents of this DVD collection, so I took the liberty of posting this list. I hope it may be useful to others.

Nothing Too Good for a Cowboy (1998) - TV Movie - 90 min - Comedy / Romance - Director: Kari Skogland - Stars: Chad Willett, Ted Atherton and Sarah Chalke.

Kid Vengeance a.k.a. Take Another Hard Ride a.k.a. Vengeance (1977) - 94 min - Western - Director: Joseph Manduke - Stars: Lee Van Cleef, Jim Brown and Leif Garrett.

Cowboys Don't Cry (1988) - 103 min - Drama - Director: Anne Wheeler - Stars: Ron White, Zachary Ansley and Janet-Laine Green.

Pony Express Rider (1976) - 100 min - Western - Director: Robert Totten - Stars: Stewart Petersen, Henry Wilcoxon and Buck Taylor.

The Gun and the Pulpit (1974) - TV Movie - 74 min - Western - Director: Daniel Petrie - Stars: Marjoe Gortner, Slim Pickens and David Huddleston.

Death Rides a Horse a.k.a. Da uomo a uomo (1967) - 114 min - Action / Western -  Director: Giulio Petroni - Stars: Lee Van Cleef, John Phillip Law and Mario Brega.

God's Gun a.k.a. Diamante Lobo (1975) - 94 min - Western - Director: Gianfranco Parolini - Stars: Lee Van Cleef, Jack Palance and Richard Boone.

Ned Blessing: The True Story of My Life (1992) - TV Movie - 97 min - Western - Director: Peter Werner - Stars: Daniel Baldwin, Luis Avalos and Chris Cooper.

Against a Crooked Sky (1975) - 89 min - Family / Western - Director: Earl Bellamy - Stars: Richard Boone, Stewart Petersen and Henry Wilcoxon.

Vengeance Valley (1951) - 83 min - Western - Director: Richard Thorpe - Stars: Burt Lancaster, Robert Walker and Joanne Dru.
Good movoes
my husband is a western fan.  He likes the older western because they do not have profanity in them.  This pack has some of his favorites actors in them and he is loving each one of them.

Once again I have run into a couple of frisbees in this packet to take to the park. Once again the quality in my opinion is extremely poor from "Echo Bridge Home Entertainment" as printed on the back of the case in the bottom left hand corner. From this point on if I see "Echo Bridge Home Entertainment" on the bacxk of any DVD case, I will not be purchasing those DVDs. I have got enough frisbees to last me for awhile. Don't waste your money!
An excellent collection of movies.  I regularly select one movie from amongst the collection to watch during my leisure time.
Great collection!
ok
Lee Van Cleef is a good actor so of course the films are good.  Bought for a friend
We love westerns old and new.  Lee Van Cleef is the greatest in spaghetti westerns.  The DVD came in great shape.  Thank you Amazon.

Reminds me of sitting in the movie theater, all day on Saturday's when I was a kid, and just hoping there was a double feature on that day.......well it's not the same, believe me.......to see the actors and how fake it was really hit me. All one has to do, these days is buy a dvd filled with old black and white westerns, and watch them and they will make you really look at the movies today, with dolby surround sound, 55 to 60 inch H.D.  TV screens, and think "how in the world will the people in the next generation think about us, and how we survived. I think about it whenever I watch these old westerns......and wonder what John Wayne, Roy Rogers, Gene Autry would be thinking about seeing these movies like we're doing now........ummmmmmmmmm. So if you want to be entertained for a few hours just buy these westerns.....
I bought this for my mom as a present. She a big western fan, but she had never seen this movies at all.
A few movies are real duds, but GODS GUN alone is worth it. A mix of Spaghetti and US Westerns.

It is poor quality.  I am throwing it away.  It's awful.
Shame on Amazon for selling it.  So disappointed in this purchase.

Boy do these take us back.......some are a bit amateurish but that would be because of the advances in technology, and storyline.
Have been spoiled with the modern westerns. Good bit of memorabilia.
Great fun to watch and are fine for most all ages. We watch them in our travel trailer. We like to watch them at home as well.
Loved the old western movies.  It is hard to find some of the old actors and this was great set.
Hate this series.  Stupid plots, good actors acting silly.  Not entertaining.  Put it in the class of "dumb and dumber!"
This is a great dvd. It had a lot of westerns I never saw before. I highly recommend it !
I enjoyed watching these because it gives a review of what went on and how things were handled during that era.
These are some of the worst movies ever made.  The spaghetti westerns are pathetic.  The others are TV movies from the 70s.  The picture quality is terrible.  What a massive waste of $5.  Pathetic.

Sure they are older movies, and the film print isn't pristine, but for the money, it's great entertainment. People try to say the film quality isn't like todays films, but in 20 to 30 years, the newer films will be the same way these are. My wife and I really enjoyed, so much we ordered a couple of more different sets. Great westerns.
Good

very old quality the movies have! I prefer something newer that looks better on the screen
I love westerns, this was a great buy. Some of these movies I haven't seen since I was a kid.
I like westerns and these are good.

Movies are my opinion a poor collection of rejects. Some value, if you do not mind language and nudity, so don't be surprised by this collection. Read and decide if you wish to add it to your movie collection? I will probably not watch more than two movies.
